posts.post_content:
Turn 3 [Mirran Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirran Crusader), then enchant it with this on the following turn, you're swinging with a 6/6 flying, doublestrike, protection from black and green on turn 4. That's not even counting any exalted bonuses you might have. This card is beastly (And so is the Crusader).  
  
Also, [Coiling Oracle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coiling Oracle) + this = Snake Elf Druid Angel.

posts.post_content:
Considering Enchantment history, the CC should be something more like:
  
   
+4/+4 = 3
  
Flying, First Strike = 2
  
Angel tribal = 0.5
  
Recurrence = 2
  
   
Should be something around a 7 or 8, to be a "normal" enchantment. But the fact that they made this roughly half of that is a very good sign, and gives hope for the future of the ever-downtrodden enchantment.
posts.html:

Angel tribal = 0.5

posts.post_content:
Let's think outside Type-II for a moment.  
  
[Evershrike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evershrike)  
  
Enjoy your recurring 8/8 flying, first striker. Do you have something like [Angelic Chorus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angelic Chorus) or [Pandemonium](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pandemonium)? [Sacrifice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacrifice) your [Evershrike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evershrike) and play it again.

posts.post_content:
The art concept and execution are phenominal. She would look fragile except for the determination on her face. The stained glass windows behind her DO look fragile though. The shot is taken from ground level, complete with out-of-focus flowers, and the wings on the window behind her frame her beautifully.   
what better way to show a fearsome opponent, with a [major chink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=naturalize)  in her armor?   
  
  
  
  
Build your own [Wombat Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wombat). You know you want to.

posts.post_content:
Wizards could print an aura with "Enchanted creature gets +8/+8, flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, lifelink, landwalk, deathtouch, and intimidate" for the low low cost of ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) ...and still nobody would play it in constructed.  
  
Rare buff auras either need to go the way of the dodo bird, or come standardized with "if this card would be put into your graveyard, return it to your hand instead" -- markedly different from equipment, but still recursive. They're great in limited, but giving precious mythic rare space to this spoils its potential there.
posts.html:
Wizards could print an aura with "Enchanted creature gets +8/+8, flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, lifelink, landwalk, deathtouch, and intimidate" for the low low cost of ...and still nobody would play it in constructed.

Rare buff auras either need to go the way of the dodo bird, or come standardized with "if this card would be put into your graveyard, return it to your hand instead" -- markedly different from equipment, but still recursive. They're great in limited, but giving precious mythic rare space to this spoils its potential there.
